topic.title: Anti-Piracy Outfit Targets ‘Troll’ Defense Sites With DMCA Takedowns
topic.body:
"An anti-piracy company working for movie outfit Lionsgate has filed several wrongful and embarrassing DMCA notices with Google. IP Arrow was supposed to be making the move Mechanic: Resurrection harder to find on pirate platforms but also hit sites - including a law firm - set up to help people being targeted by copyright trolls 'protecting' the same content."

awesome. xD

https://torrentfreak.com/anti-piracy-outfit-targets-troll-defense-sites-with-dmca-takedowns-170923/

1_1DCTA8rrSFeKX7CzieU3CYwCjGZ2hYvamb.body:
> [ulrichard](#comment_27_1PSaHi14Xh4Kjo3yyjDgbRtj4YLQgWV4QJ): Sure it is possible... By brute force. The trick is to tune it in order to find your Bitcoin private key before the universe cools to a halt.

it's true. all of it.

1_1NmT7R64j1uMJ9qs3Bfgda5cGczFqNmCBL.body:
if you're serious about coding: C/C++ and assembler (x86/64, ARM).
if that hurts your mind: try python.

> [monday](#comment_1_12xyMN9EMfzW1qqKCUNN5LLzxUUHpbrYXX): javascript would be a good choice, as it's used in the backend (node.js), frontend (which runs in the browser), and database (mongodb, or anything with json, instead of SQL / etc). What is you goal ? earn much, or be productive. I know it's controversial....

learning javascript is a terrible choice if you're not interested in building web driven crap.
javascript is also a pile of garbage and a security nightmare.

1_1KAKF4nVCWqJbrVPWxFvRNuU1zLkwVtC8L.body:
"man-made avian influenza" - "china will perish" .. lol. wtf. no. china has been around forever and will probably still be around until the sun consumes all of its fuel. and this man made flu nonsense is something that looks like it came from one of those bizarre conspiracy sites.

tl;dr: proof or gtfo.
